posts.post_content: @Dingo777 Because that doesn't make sense either. "Jace Beleren" and "Jace the Mind Sculpter" are the same guy at different points in his life. Same with "Sarkhan Vol" and "Sarkhan the Mad" or "Elspeth, Night Errant" and "Elspeth Tirel". That's the reason for the subtypes. Having both of them out is no different (foul-)flavour-wise than having 2 Jace Belerens out.

posts.post_content: Jace r hax. I put him in my u/w control deck, and giving your opponent hand advantage doesn't matter when 1) they may have to discard 2) it will allow you to draw all your counters where you will be having the upper hand and control of the situation better and make them somewhat mad. His mill effect is crazy too, so in all, he's worth the 3 mana you used to get him out.

Posted By: TheAmberSpyglass (8/2/2012 12:42:46 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Oh my god I **HATE** that artwork! He looks like he's in a bomb squad suit or something. Maybe he is, \*I\* would certainly want to be if I was up against Chandra. And he really needs to do something with that hair.  
  
I don't have the dual deck set so I can't really comment how he plays in it.  
  
In general, hes cheap to cast, and can just draw you three cards over three turns if you don't want to go for the mill. I always find that making my opponent draw cards when i'm using blue always winds up screwing me, so i'm not a fan of his +2 ability. His -10 is good because it won't kill him if you've just used his +2 all the way, but it's only good if you're running a mill deck, unlike [Jace, the mind sculptor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Jace, the mind sculptor) whose -12 could end the game in one shot.
posts.html:
Oh my god I HATE that artwork! He looks like he's in a bomb squad suit or something. Maybe he is, *I* would certainly want to be if I was up against Chandra. And he really needs to do something with that hair.

I don't have the dual deck set so I can't really comment how he plays in it.

In general, hes cheap to cast, and can just draw you three cards over three turns if you don't want to go for the mill. I always find that making my opponent draw cards when i'm using blue always winds up screwing me, so i'm not a fan of his +2 ability. His -10 is good because it won't kill him if you've just used his +2 all the way, but it's only good if you're running a mill deck, unlike Jace, the mind sculptor whose -12 could end the game in one shot.
